com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector

Class ParametrisedGeneType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector.ParametrisedGeneType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BainParametrisedGeneType

    public class ParametrisedGeneType
extends ConfigurableBase
    A component that encapsulates the configuration for a type of Gene and/or {Allele} that define a set of evolvable parameters.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable

        Observable.Event

      protected VectorMetadata paramsGene 
      protected VectorMetadata paramsType 
      int paramsTypeCount
      If paramsType is non-empty, this is the number of types that should be available.
      VectorMetadata paramsTypeReference
      If paramsType is non-empty, this is a reference to the one of paramsGene or {#paramsAllele} which contains the "typeReference" parameter.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParametrisedGeneType(Configuration config) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector createAlleleVector()
      Returns a mutable Vector with metadata set to getParamsAllele() and with values initialised to zero.
      Vector createGeneVector(java.util.Random random)
      Returns an immutable Vector with metadata set to getParamsGene() and with random values distributed uniformly between their minimum and maximum values (inclusive).
      Vector createTypeVector()
      Returns a mutable Vector with metadata set to getParamsType() and with values initialised to zero.
      VectorMetadata getParamsAllele()
      The available parameters, and associated properties, whose value is an allele and so may change after this type of gene is added.
      VectorMetadata getParamsGene()
      The available parameters, and associated properties, whose values should be fixed when a gene of this type is added.
      VectorMetadata getParamsType()
      Similar to getParamsGene(), however the parameters specified here are intended to be referenced from other genes or alleles (see #getParamsTypeReference()), instead of those parameters being set or evolved individually in each gene or allele.
      void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
      Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).

      • Methods inherited from class com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase

        equals, getConfiguration, getFieldRuntimeType, getSingleton, getSuperClasses, hashCode, newGenericInstance

    • Field Detail

      • paramsGene

        @Configurable(description="The available parameters, and associated properties, whose values should be fixed when a gene of this type is added.")
protected VectorMetadata paramsGene

      • paramsAllele

        @Configurable(description="The available parameters, and associated properties, whose value is an allele and so may change after this type of gene is added.")
protected VectorMetadata paramsAllele

      • paramsType

        @Configurable(description="Similar to paramsAllele, however the parameters specified here are intended to be referenced from other genes or alleles, instead of those parameters being set or evolved individually in each gene or allele. If this is set to a non-empty value then an integer parameter labeled \"typeReference\" must be added to one of paramsGene or paramsAllele; this is used as the reference to the type. The minimum value for the typeReference must be 0 and the maximum value must be one less than the number of types that should be allowed.")
protected VectorMetadata paramsType

      • paramsTypeReference

        public final VectorMetadata paramsTypeReference
        If paramsType is non-empty, this is a reference to the one of paramsGene or {#paramsAllele} which contains the "typeReference" parameter.

      • paramsTypeCount

        public final int paramsTypeCount
        If paramsType is non-empty, this is the number of types that should be available.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParametrisedGeneType

        public ParametrisedGeneType(Configuration config)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • getParamsGene

        public VectorMetadata getParamsGene()
        The available parameters, and associated properties, whose values should be fixed when a gene of this type is added.

      • getParamsAllele

        public VectorMetadata getParamsAllele()
        The available parameters, and associated properties, whose value is an allele and so may change after this type of gene is added.

      • getParamsType

        public VectorMetadata getParamsType()
        Similar to getParamsGene(), however the parameters specified here are intended to be referenced from other genes or alleles (see #getParamsTypeReference()), instead of those parameters being set or evolved individually in each gene or allele. #getParamsTypeCount() alleles should be created containing values for these parameters.

      • createGeneVector

        public Vector createGeneVector(java.util.Random random)
        Returns an immutable Vector with metadata set to getParamsGene() and with random values distributed uniformly between their minimum and maximum values (inclusive).

      • createAlleleVector

        public Vector createAlleleVector()
        Returns a mutable Vector with metadata set to getParamsAllele() and with values initialised to zero.

      • createTypeVector

        public Vector createTypeVector()
        Returns a mutable Vector with metadata set to getParamsType() and with values initialised to zero.

      • getStringableMap

        public void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object). When overriding this method in a sub-class the super-class implementation should usually be called from the overriding implementation.
        Specified by:
        getStringableMap in interface Stringable
        Overrides:
        getStringableMap in class ConfigurableBase
        Parameters:
        map - Mapping from descriptive labels to Objects that can be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).
